availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, clerk. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas S. Theobald and Sarah Theobald. Married to Mary Ellen Cox Theobald in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on February 14, 1861. Father of Nellie Theobald and Thomas S. Theobald. Resident in Franklin County in 1850. Household owned twenty enslaved people in Louisville in 1850. Clerk in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 33A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 871.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 4, p. 20.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, X County, City/District, p. 101A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000819614.
"Edwin Samuel Theobald (1830-1888)," Find A Grave, Memorial #64378435, accessed November 1, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/64378435.
